018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.Collections;
022import org.opengis.util.ScopedName;
023import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
024
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
026
027
028/**
029 * A constant value that can be used in expressions.
030 * The {@link #apply(R)} method of this class must return the same value as {@link #getValue()}.
031 *
032 * <h2>Type of values</h2>
033 * The content of {@link #getValue()} may be persisted with XML based technologies.
034 * As an example a {@link org.opengis.geometry.Geometry} may be written out using GML.
035 * Consequently, the value should be data objects such as strings, numbers, dates, or geometries.
036 * It should not be state of operations.
037 *
038 * @author  Chris Dillard (SYS Technologies)
039 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
040 * @version 3.1
041 *
042 * @param  <R>  the type of resources used as inputs. This is ignored by literals.
043 * @param  <V>  the type of the value given by the literal.
044 *
045 * @since 3.1
046 */
047@UML(identifier="Literal", specification=ISO_19143)
048public interface Literal<R,V> extends Expression<R,V> {
049    /**
050     * Returns the name of the literal function.
051     * The default implementation returns {@code "fes:Literal"}.
052     *
053     * @return {@code "Literal"} in a scope at implementation choice.
054     */
055    @Override
056    default ScopedName getFunctionName() {
057        return Name.LITERAL;
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Returns the class of resources accepted by this expression.
062     * The default implementation of this method returns {@code Object.class} because
063     * the resource is ignored by the default implementation of {@link #apply(Object)},
064     * and thus can be anything.
065     *
066     * @return {@code Object.class}.
067     */
068    @Override
069    default Class<? super R> getResourceClass() {
070        return Object.class;
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Returns an empty list since literals have no parameters.
075     *
076     * @return an empty list.
077     */
078    @Override
079    default List<Expression<R,?>> getParameters() {
080        return Collections.emptyList();
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Returns the constant value held by this object.
085     * It should be a data object such as a string, number, date or geometry.
086     *
087     * @return the literal value. May be {@code null}.
088     */
089    @UML(identifier="value", specification=ISO_19143)       // Conceptually mandatory even if we allow null.
090    V getValue();
091
092    /**
093     * Evaluates the expression value.
094     * Shall be the same value as {@link #getValue()}.
095     *
096     * @param  input  ignored (may be {@code null}).
097     * @return the literal value.
098     */
099    @Override
100    default V apply(R input) {
101        return getValue();
102    }
103
104    /*
105     * NOTE: it would be possible to implement a default `toValueType(Class)` method if we were sure that this
106     * literal has no method expecting a <V> argument (e.g. setter method). This `Literal` interface  does not
107     * define such method, but implementation could. If such methods exist, then the <R,N> parameterized types
108     * would be incorrect and would need to be <R, ? extends N>. Only implementer knows if it is safe to cast,
109     * so we do not provide default implementation for that reason.
110     */
111}
